snippet: A lack of political will, poor environmental management and a long dry spell have conspired to put São Paulo, a metropolitan area of 20 million, on the verge of a harsh rationing plan.
abstract: Residents of Sao Paulo, Brazil, face unprecedented water crisis as city's reservoir system nears depletion due to drought; will likely have to submit to water rationing, and could even be asked to flee city due to shortage; crisis has been worsened by pollution, deforestation, population growth and lack of political will, despite fact that Brazil is one of world's most water-rich nations.
lead_paragraph: A lack of political will, poor environmental management and a long dry spell have conspired to put São Paulo, a metropolitan area of 20 million, on the verge of a harsh rationing plan.
